page.title: 10Local History
page.content: Hundon still has a considerable numer of ancient buildings many still having thatch roofs though the cost of replacing the thatch is causing many owners to replace with old tile in some cases peg and others pantiles. Probably the oldest house in the village is "Thatchers Hall" formerly known as "The Thatchers". This is a fine fifteen century "Wealdon" type house. It is timber framed and plastered with the end bays jettied on the first storey and the roof carried over in line with the front of the jettied bays, supported on brackets. The original thatch has now been replaced by old peg tiles. The hall had an upper storey inserted during the sixtth century. The original cambered tie beam and a good crown post. (Continued on page 11)
